original_text:
Montezuma
Le popolazioni precolombiane hanno affascinato la loro parte di case di sviluppo, le quali hanno dedicato slot agli Inca, ai Maya e agli Aztechi. Proprio per quest’ultimo popolo e per il suo re, Montezuma, è stato creato questo gioco da parte della WMS.
Andiamo a scoprire di che tipo di slot stiamo parlando.
Montezuma: il comparto visivo
Da un punto di vista grafico, la slot si presenta con una griglia di gioco molto piccola pronta ad espandersi sullo schermo al momento delle nostre giocate. In questo modo ci è possibile osservare la cornice che fa da sfondo a questo titolo, la quale mostra un frammento delle foreste in cui si celavano i tempi aztechi.
Il colore dominante della slot è il giallo e le sue sfumature, facendo un occhiolino all’oro e al mito delle città costruite interamente in questo metallo.
Parlando dei simboli che si trovano sui rulli, questi rappresentano le varie sfaccettature di questa cultura, anche se le lettere relative alle carte da gioco (A, K, Q e J), molto comuni nelle slot online, sono un po’ fuori posto in questo caso.
Da un punto di vista sonoro, non c’è una musica che accompagni le varie giocate, ma solo dei suoni che scandiscono il girare dei rulli e le eventuali vincite.
Montezuma: come giocare
Passiamo ora alla parte tecnica di questa nostra recensione di Montezuma della WMS. Questa casa di sviluppo è famosa per portare avanti due correnti di pensiero: da una parte troviamo le slot con un gameplay unico e difficile da padroneggiare, dall’altra troviamo invece un filone di slot più tradizionali.
Montezuma rientra in questa seconda categoria, come è facile presupporre vedendo la griglia di gioco: ci troviamo di fronte a uno schema 5*3 con trenta linee di vincita. Una slot quindi che ripercorre la strada già tracciata da numerosi altri titoli prima di lei.
Come da tradizione, anche in questo caso troviamo due simboli speciali che possono movimentare il nostro gioco: il primo è il tempio, il quale ricopre il ruolo di Wild, ovvero un jolly che può sostituire qualsiasi altro simbolo ad eccezione dell’altro speciale.
Questo altro non è che una ruota molto simile a una roulette: trovandone almeno 3 in un’unica giocata (se ne possono trovare fino a 5) è possibile attivare la modalità a giri gratuiti. Non sarà necessario che questi simboli appaiano sulla stessa linea, in quanto questa è proprio una caratteristica dei simboli Scatter.
All’inizio di questa modalità, ci verranno assegnati tramite la ruota stessa un numero di giri che va da un minimo di 3 a un massimo di 25. Inoltre all’inizio di ogni turno la ruota girerà nuovamente assegnando un moltiplicatore sulle vincite che va da un minimo di 2X a un massimo di 10X.
Slot simili a Montezuma
Esistono molte altre slot che utilizzano la storia e le civiltà antiche come tematica. Da un punto di vista di civiltà precolombiane, possiamo nominare Mayan Temple Revenge della Capecod, ma ampliando il nostro campo di ricerca possiamo trovare decine di slot dedicate all’antico Egitto, come Book of Ra della Novomatic o Lady of Egypt della stessa WMS.
Anche l’antica Roma e Grecia rappresentano momenti storici molto utilizzati e, in epoca più recente, la Londra vittoriana è anch’essa molto apprezzata dai produttori di slot. Cerca quella che fa per te!

raw_translation.response:
Montezuma

The pre-Columbian civilizations have fascinated numerous developers in the gaming industry, who have dedicated slots to the Incas, Mayans, and Aztecs. This game, created by WMS, is dedicated to the Aztec people and their king, Montezuma. Let's discover what type of slot this is.

Montezuma: Visuals
From a graphical standpoint, the slot presents a small game grid that expands on the screen during gameplay. This allows us to see the Aztec forest background that frames this title. The dominant color is yellow and its shades, paying tribute to gold and the myth of cities built entirely out of this metal.

Regarding the symbols on the reels, they represent various facets of Aztec culture, although the letters associated with playing cards (A, K, Q, and J), very common in online slots, are a bit out of place in this case. Sonically, there isn't any music accompanying gameplay, just sounds that punctuate the spin of the reels and any eventual wins.

Montezuma: How to Play
Now let's move on to the technical part of this review of WMS' Montezuma. This game developer is famous for promoting two lines of thought: on the one hand, there are slots with unique gameplay that are tough to master, and on the other, we have a more traditional slot line. Montezuma belongs to the latter category.

As we can tell from looking at the game grid, we are faced with a 5x3 layout with thirty paylines. This is a slot that follows in the footsteps of many before it. In keeping with tradition, we also find two special symbols that can spice up our game: the first is the temple, which serves as the wild symbol that can replace any other symbol, except for the other special symbol.

The latter is a wheel very similar to a roulette wheel: finding at least three in a single spin (up to five can appear) activates the free spin mode. These symbols don't need to appear on the same payline because this is a characteristic of scatter symbols.

At the beginning of this mode, the wheel itself assigns us a number of spins ranging from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 25. Additionally, at the beginning of each turn, the wheel spins again to assign a multiplier to wins that range from a minimum of 2x to a maximum of 10x.

Similar Slots to Montezuma
There are many other slots that use ancient civilizations as a theme. From a pre-Columbian civilization standpoint, we can mention Capecod's Mayan Temple Revenge, but widening our search, we can find dozens of slots dedicated to ancient Egypt such as Novomatic's Book of Ra or WMS' Lady of Egypt. Ancient Rome and Greece also represent popular historical periods. More recently, Victorian London has also become popular among slot developers. Find the one that suits you best!

Let's move on to the technical part of this Montezuma review by WMS. This game developer is famous for two things: unique and challenging gameplay and more traditional slots. Montezuma falls into the latter category, evident from the 5x3 reel layout with thirty paylines. The slot game follows the footsteps of countless other games that have come before it.

As tradition holds, the game has two special symbols that can change our gameplay: The first is the temple, which is the game's Wild symbol, meaning it can replace any symbol except the other special symbol. These symbols do not have to appear on the same payline, as this is a feature of Scatter symbols.

At the beginning of this mode, the wheel assigns a number of spins ranging from a minimum of three to a maximum of twenty-five. Additionally, at the start of each turn, the wheel spins again to assign a multiplier on wins, ranging from a minimum of 2x to a maximum of 10x.

response.headline: Gameplay mechanics and layout
response.content: Montezuma is a traditional 5x3 online slot game with thirty paylines. response.headline: Special symbols and features

response.headline: Free spin mode

response.headline: Comparison to other similar games

Sonically, there isn't any music accompanying gameplay, just sounds that punctuate the spin of the reels and any eventual wins.

Montezuma: How to Play
Now let's move on to the technical part of this review of WMS' Montezuma. This game developer is famous for promoting two lines of thought: on the one hand, there are slots with unique gameplay that are tough to master, and on the other, we have a more traditional slot line. As we can tell from looking at the game grid, we are faced with a 5x3 layout with thirty paylines. This is a slot that follows in the footsteps of many before it. The latter is a wheel very similar to a roulette wheel: finding at least three in a single spin (up to five can appear) activates the free spin mode. These symbols don't need to appear on the same payline because this is a characteristic of scatter symbols.

At the beginning of this mode, the wheel itself assigns us a number of spins ranging from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 25. Additionally, at the beginning of each turn, the wheel spins again to assign a multiplier to wins that range from a minimum of 2x to a maximum of 10x.

response.headline: Similar Slots You Might Want to Try
response.content:
So you're a fan of Montezuma, huh? Well, don't worry, there are plenty more slot games out there that invite you to explore ancient civilizations - without the mosquito bites.

If you're looking for something similar to Montezuma, you could check out Mayan Temple Revenge. Think of it as the angry cousin of Montezuma, complete with pyramids, wild animals, and a whole lot of revenge.

If ancient Egypt piques your interest, you could give Book of Ra a go. It has all the hieroglyphics, jackals, and mummies you could ask for.

Perhaps you'd like to meet the lady who put the 'Egypt' in Cleopatra? Then Lady of Egypt is your game. It's got enough sand to make even the Sphinx envious.

But maybe watching the movie '300' one too many times has you craving more Spartan action. Enter Zeus III, where you can feel like a Greek hero with every spin.

If you're into investigating mysteries, give Sherlock Holmes: The Hunt for Blackwood a whirl. You'll feel like you're right in the middle of a Victorian London crime scene.

These symbols don't need to appear on the same payline because they function as scatter symbols.

Free Spin Mode

The free spin mode in Montezuma is activated when three or more roulette wheel symbols appear on the reels. Players can receive up to 25 spins, and each spin is subject to a win multiplier, ranging from 2x to 10x. The multiplier is assigned at the beginning of each spin by the roulette wheel. This feature adds excitement to the gameplay and offers players a chance to boost their winnings.

Other Similar Slot Games

There are many other online slot games that use ancient civilizations as a theme. For instance, if you enjoyed Montezuma's pre-Columbian civilization theme, you may want to try Capecod's Mayan Temple Revenge. Alternatively, if you're a fan of ancient Egypt, you could try Novomatic's Book of Ra or WMS' Lady of Egypt. Those interested in ancient Rome and Greece might enjoy games like Rome & Egypt or Zeus III, respectively. Additionally, players looking for something more recent could try a game like Sherlock Holmes: The Hunt for Blackwood for a Victorian London theme.

Review: Montezuma

The pre-Columbian civilizations have fascinated numerous developers in the gaming industry, who have dedicated slots to the Incas, Mayans, and Aztecs. This game, created by WMS, is dedicated to the Aztec people and their king, Montezuma. Let's discover what type of slot this is.

Montezuma: Visuals
From a graphical standpoint, the slot presents a small game grid that expands on the screen during gameplay. This allows us to see the Aztec forest background that frames this title. The dominant color is yellow and its shades, paying tribute to gold and the myth of cities built entirely out of this metal.

Regarding the symbols on the reels, they represent various facets of Aztec culture, although the letters associated with playing cards (A, K, Q, and J), very common in online slots, are a bit out of place in this case. Sonically, there isn't any music accompanying gameplay, just sounds that punctuate the spin of the reels and any eventual wins.

Montezuma: How to Play
Now let's move on to the technical part of this review of WMS' Montezuma. This game developer is famous for promoting two lines of thought: on the one hand, there are slots with unique gameplay that are tough to master, and on the other, we have a more traditional slot line. Montezuma belongs to the latter category.

As we can tell from looking at the game grid, we are faced with a 5x3 layout with thirty paylines. This is a slot that follows in the footsteps of many before it. In keeping with tradition, we also find two special symbols that can spice up our game: the first is the temple, which serves as the wild symbol that can replace any other symbol, except for the other special symbol.

The latter is a wheel very similar to a roulette wheel: finding at least three in a single spin (up to five can appear) activates the free spin mode. These symbols don't need to appear on the same payline because this is a characteristic of scatter symbols.

At the beginning of this mode, the wheel itself assigns us a number of spins ranging from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 25. Additionally, at the beginning of each turn, the wheel spins again to assign a multiplier to wins that range from a minimum of 2x to a maximum of 10x.

Similar Slots to Montezuma
There are many other slots that use ancient civilizations as a theme. From a pre-Columbian civilization standpoint, we can mention Capecod's Mayan Temple Revenge, but widening our search, we can find dozens of slots dedicated to ancient Egypt such as Novomatic's Book of Ra or WMS' Lady of Egypt. Ancient Rome and Greece also represent popular historical periods. More recently, Victorian London has also become popular among slot developers. Find the one that suits you best!
